title: JetBlue will use Amazon’s Project Kuiper satellites for free in-flight internet
description: While many other airlines are choosing Starlink, JetBlue is opting for Amazon’s newer Kuiper satellites. But the service won’t launch until 2027.

title: Google’s Circle to Search can now translate as you scroll
description: Google’s Circle to Search feature now supports translation.

title: Only 2 days left to claim your exhibitor spot at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
description: Put your startup in the heart of the action — where 10,000+ founders, investors, press, and decision-makers come to discover what’s next.

title: Adobe to bring its video editing app Premiere to iPhones
description: Adobe is planning to bring its video editing software Premiere to the iPhone. The company has listed the app on the App Store with a pre-order link and an expected release date of September 30.

title: Atlassian to buy Arc developer The Browser Company for $610M
description: Productivity software maker Atlassian has agreed to acquire The Browser Company, which makes the Arc and Dia browsers, for $610 million in cash.

title: DuckDuckGo adds access to advanced AI models to its subscription plan
description: With DuckDuckGo’s $9.99 per month plan, users will be able to access newer models, including OpenAI’s GPT-4o and GPT-5, Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4, and Meta’s Llama Maverick.

title: Madrid’s Orbital Paradigm aims to prove a cheaper path to orbital reentry
description: Orbital Paradigm is moving fast and cheap to industrialize low Earth orbit.
